AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Andrew P. Graham: Border Patrol Agent with three years' experience serving in the Alpine area, testified about the driver's behavior contributing to reasonable suspicion, involved in at least 30 narcotics cases and 15 to 20 alien smuggling cases, notified by Marfa Sector Communications about vehicle sensors indicating northbound vehicles, followed a late model four-door sedan carrying an older Anglo couple, observed a work truck with a Kansas license plate
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot: Defendant in a drug trafficking case, exhibited suspicious behavior while driving, sole passenger in the truck, found with 286.44 pounds of marijuana and two unloaded handguns, argues against the suspicion of the truck's behavior, contested the application of a two-level upward adjustment for possession of a weapon, described as a small-framed person wearing a baseball cap
